title: Use GraphQL to delete a history note comment for a vulnerability
description:
When viewing an individual vulnerability on the security dashboard, at the bottom of a page is a list of history notes that shows changes to the vulnerability state:
||
|-|
|![ksnip_20200914-224641](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/uploads/12565ad5ee0506953d345d0c2246822a/ksnip_20200914-224641.png)|

A comment can be added to a note. If a comment exists and is deleted, currently this is done using a REST endpoint. We need to use GraphQL instead. To generate a note so that you can add a comment and then delete it, change the status of the vulnerability at the top of the page using the dropdown:
||
|-|
|![Screenshot_from_2020-09-14_22-51-32](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/uploads/f36e80ca6636b41f466b8166a3e0133a/Screenshot_from_2020-09-14_22-51-32.png)|

See [Design Issue](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/issues/223059) and parent Epic for details.

## Implementation Plan

* [ ] Update `deleteComment()` in [`ee/app/assets/javascripts/vulnerabilities/components/history_comment.vue`](http://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/blob/4f028edce179d212d91417e5dc3168cdd03e4718/ee/app/assets/javascripts/vulnerabilities/components/history_comment.vue#L104-104) to use GraphQL.

epic.title: Vulnerability GraphQL resource to access a single vulnerability

title: Use GraphQL to save/update a history note comment for a vulnerability
description:
When viewing an individual vulnerability on the security dashboard, at the bottom of a page is a list of history notes that shows changes to the vulnerability state:

||
|-|
|![ksnip_20200914-224641](/uploads/12565ad5ee0506953d345d0c2246822a/ksnip_20200914-224641.png)|

A comment can be added to a note. Currently, the comment is saved using a REST endpoint. We need to use GraphQL instead. To generate a note so that you can add a comment to it, change the status of the vulnerability at the top of the page using the dropdown:

||
|-|
|![Screenshot_from_2020-09-14_22-51-32](/uploads/f36e80ca6636b41f466b8166a3e0133a/Screenshot_from_2020-09-14_22-51-32.png)|

See [Design Issue](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/issues/223059) and parent Epic for details.

## Implementation Plan

- [ ] Update `saveComment()` in [`ee/app/assets/javascripts/vulnerabilities/components/history_comment.vue`](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/blob/4f028edce179d212d91417e5dc3168cdd03e4718/ee/app/assets/javascripts/vulnerabilities/components/history_comment.vue#L84-84) to use GraphQL. Verify that it works for both saving new notes and updating existing notes.

title: Use GraphQL to retrieve the history notes for a vulnerability
description:
When viewing an individual vulnerability on the security dashboard, at the bottom of a page is a list of history notes that shows changes to the vulnerability state:

||
|-|
|![ksnip_20200914-224641](/uploads/12565ad5ee0506953d345d0c2246822a/ksnip_20200914-224641.png)|

Currently, these notes are retrieved through a REST endpoint. We need to use GraphQL instead. To generate more notes, change the status of the vulnerability at the top of the page using the dropdown:

||
|-|
|![Screenshot_from_2020-09-14_22-51-32](/uploads/f36e80ca6636b41f466b8166a3e0133a/Screenshot_from_2020-09-14_22-51-32.png)|

See [Design Issue](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/issues/223059) and parent Epic for details.

## Implementation Plan

- [x] ~frontend Change `fetchDiscussions()` in [`ee/app/assets/javascripts/vulnerabilities/components/footer.vue`](http://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/blob/a528ed7f23ad62024b28907bb347abcdfef970ea/ee/app/assets/javascripts/vulnerabilities/components/footer.vue#L112-112) to use GraphQL.
- [x] ~frontend The page continually polls for new notes. Investigate whether it's possible to use GraphQL with polling, and if so, change [`createNotesPoll()`](http://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/blob/a528ed7f23ad62024b28907bb347abcdfef970ea/ee/app/assets/javascripts/vulnerabilities/components/footer.vue#L146-146) in the same file to use GraphQL.
- [x] ~backend As per [this comment](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/issues/228742#note_397383637), look into whether [this workaround](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/merge_requests/38814) can be removed after switching to GraphQL.

title: Use GraphQL for the vulnerability state dropdown
description:
When viewing an individual vulnerability on the security dashboard, there is a dropdown that lets the user change the status of the vulnerability:

||
|-|
|![ksnip_20200914-223513](/uploads/67c84f337ff452dd8454429ee7d67578/ksnip_20200914-223513.png)|

Currently, changing the status will call a REST endpoint. We need to use GraphQL instead.

See [Design Issue](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/issues/223059) and parent Epic for details.

## Implementation Plan

- [ ] Change `changeVulnerabilityState()` and `refreshVulnerability()` in [`ee/app/assets/javascripts/vulnerabilities/components/header.vue`](http://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/blob/a528ed7f23ad62024b28907bb347abcdfef970ea/ee/app/assets/javascripts/vulnerabilities/components/header.vue) to use GraphQL. `refreshVulnerability()` is called from [`ee/app/assets/javascripts/vulnerabilities/components/vulnerability.vue`](http://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/blob/a528ed7f23ad62024b28907bb347abcdfef970ea/ee/app/assets/javascripts/vulnerabilities/components/vulnerability.vue#L18-18), we should look into whether we still need it after switching to GraphQL.
